Target.h

1 #ifndef HALIDE_TARGET_H
2 #define HALIDE_TARGET_H
3 
4 /** \file
5  * Defines the structure that describes a Halide target.
6  */
7 
8 #include <bitset>
9 #include <cstdint>
10 #include <string>
11 
12 #include "DeviceAPI.h"
13 #include "Type.h"
14 #include "runtime/HalideRuntime.h"
15 
16 namespace Halide {
17 
18 /** A struct representing a target machine and os to generate code for. */
19 struct Target {
20  /** The operating system used by the target. Determines which
21  * system calls to generate.
22  * Corresponds to os_name_map in Target.cpp. */
23  enum OS {
24  OSUnknown = 0,
25  Linux,
26  Windows,
27  OSX,
28  Android,
29  IOS,
30  QuRT,
31  NoOS,
32  Fuchsia,
33  WebAssemblyRuntime
34  } os = OSUnknown;
35 
36  /** The architecture used by the target. Determines the
37  * instruction set to use.
38  * Corresponds to arch_name_map in Target.cpp. */
39  enum Arch {
40  ArchUnknown = 0,
41  X86,
42  ARM,
43  MIPS,
44  Hexagon,
45  POWERPC,
46  WebAssembly,
47  RISCV
48  } arch = ArchUnknown;
49 
50  /** The bit-width of the target machine. Must be 0 for unknown, or 32 or 64. */
51  int bits = 0;
52 
53  /** Optional features a target can have.
54  * Corresponds to feature_name_map in Target.cpp.
55  * See definitions in HalideRuntime.h for full information.
56  */
57  enum Feature {
58  JIT = halide_target_feature_jit,
59  Debug = halide_target_feature_debug,
60  NoAsserts = halide_target_feature_no_asserts,
61  NoBoundsQuery = halide_target_feature_no_bounds_query,
62  SSE41 = halide_target_feature_sse41,
63  AVX = halide_target_feature_avx,
64  AVX2 = halide_target_feature_avx2,
65  FMA = halide_target_feature_fma,
66  FMA4 = halide_target_feature_fma4,
67  F16C = halide_target_feature_f16c,
68  ARMv7s = halide_target_feature_armv7s,
69  NoNEON = halide_target_feature_no_neon,
70  VSX = halide_target_feature_vsx,
71  POWER_ARCH_2_07 = halide_target_feature_power_arch_2_07,
72  CUDA = halide_target_feature_cuda,
73  CUDACapability30 = halide_target_feature_cuda_capability30,
74  CUDACapability32 = halide_target_feature_cuda_capability32,
75  CUDACapability35 = halide_target_feature_cuda_capability35,
76  CUDACapability50 = halide_target_feature_cuda_capability50,
77  CUDACapability61 = halide_target_feature_cuda_capability61,
78  CUDACapability70 = halide_target_feature_cuda_capability70,
79  CUDACapability75 = halide_target_feature_cuda_capability75,
80  CUDACapability80 = halide_target_feature_cuda_capability80,
81  OpenCL = halide_target_feature_opencl,
82  CLDoubles = halide_target_feature_cl_doubles,
83  CLHalf = halide_target_feature_cl_half,
84  CLAtomics64 = halide_target_feature_cl_atomic64,
85  OpenGLCompute = halide_target_feature_openglcompute,
86  EGL = halide_target_feature_egl,
87  UserContext = halide_target_feature_user_context,
88  Matlab = halide_target_feature_matlab,
89  Profile = halide_target_feature_profile,
90  NoRuntime = halide_target_feature_no_runtime,
91  Metal = halide_target_feature_metal,
92  CPlusPlusMangling = halide_target_feature_c_plus_plus_mangling,
93  LargeBuffers = halide_target_feature_large_buffers,
94  HexagonDma = halide_target_feature_hexagon_dma,
95  HVX_128 = halide_target_feature_hvx_128,
96  HVX = HVX_128,
97  HVX_v62 = halide_target_feature_hvx_v62,
98  HVX_v65 = halide_target_feature_hvx_v65,
99  HVX_v66 = halide_target_feature_hvx_v66,
100  HVX_shared_object = halide_target_feature_hvx_use_shared_object,
101  FuzzFloatStores = halide_target_feature_fuzz_float_stores,
102  SoftFloatABI = halide_target_feature_soft_float_abi,
103  MSAN = halide_target_feature_msan,
104  AVX512 = halide_target_feature_avx512,
105  AVX512_KNL = halide_target_feature_avx512_knl,
106  AVX512_Skylake = halide_target_feature_avx512_skylake,
107  AVX512_Cannonlake = halide_target_feature_avx512_cannonlake,
108  AVX512_SapphireRapids = halide_target_feature_avx512_sapphirerapids,
109  TraceLoads = halide_target_feature_trace_loads,
110  TraceStores = halide_target_feature_trace_stores,
111  TraceRealizations = halide_target_feature_trace_realizations,
112  TracePipeline = halide_target_feature_trace_pipeline,
113  D3D12Compute = halide_target_feature_d3d12compute,
114  StrictFloat = halide_target_feature_strict_float,
115  TSAN = halide_target_feature_tsan,
116  ASAN = halide_target_feature_asan,
117  CheckUnsafePromises = halide_target_feature_check_unsafe_promises,
118  EmbedBitcode = halide_target_feature_embed_bitcode,
119  EnableLLVMLoopOpt = halide_target_feature_enable_llvm_loop_opt,
120  DisableLLVMLoopOpt = halide_target_feature_disable_llvm_loop_opt,
121  WasmSimd128 = halide_target_feature_wasm_simd128,
122  WasmSignExt = halide_target_feature_wasm_signext,
123  WasmSatFloatToInt = halide_target_feature_wasm_sat_float_to_int,
124  WasmThreads = halide_target_feature_wasm_threads,
125  WasmBulkMemory = halide_target_feature_wasm_bulk_memory,
126  SVE = halide_target_feature_sve,
127  SVE2 = halide_target_feature_sve2,
128  ARMDotProd = halide_target_feature_arm_dot_prod,
129  LLVMLargeCodeModel = halide_llvm_large_code_model,
130  RVV = halide_target_feature_rvv,
131  FeatureEnd = halide_target_feature_end
132  };
133  Target() = default;
134  Target(OS o, Arch a, int b, const std::vector<Feature> &initial_features = std::vector<Feature>())
135  : os(o), arch(a), bits(b) {
136  for (const auto &f : initial_features) {
137  set_feature(f);
138  }
139  }
140 
141  /** Given a string of the form used in HL_TARGET
142  * (e.g. "x86-64-avx"), construct the Target it specifies. Note
143  * that this always starts with the result of get_host_target(),
144  * replacing only the parts found in the target string, so if you
145  * omit (say) an OS specification, the host OS will be used
146  * instead. An empty string is exactly equivalent to
147  * get_host_target().
148  *
149  * Invalid target strings will fail with a user_error.
150  */
151  // @{
152  explicit Target(const std::string &s);
153  explicit Target(const char *s);
154  // @}
155 
156  /** Check if a target string is valid. */
157  static bool validate_target_string(const std::string &s);
158 
159  /** Return true if any of the arch/bits/os fields are "unknown"/0;
160  return false otherwise. */
161  bool has_unknowns() const;
162 
163  void set_feature(Feature f, bool value = true);
164 
165  void set_features(const std::vector<Feature> &features_to_set, bool value = true);
166 
167  bool has_feature(Feature f) const;
168 
169  inline bool has_feature(halide_target_feature_t f) const {
170  return has_feature((Feature)f);
171  }
172 
173  bool features_any_of(const std::vector<Feature> &test_features) const;
174 
175  bool features_all_of(const std::vector<Feature> &test_features) const;
176 
177  /** Return a copy of the target with the given feature set.
178  * This is convenient when enabling certain features (e.g. NoBoundsQuery)
179  * in an initialization list, where the target to be mutated may be
180  * a const reference. */
181  Target with_feature(Feature f) const;
182 
183  /** Return a copy of the target with the given feature cleared.
184  * This is convenient when disabling certain features (e.g. NoBoundsQuery)
185  * in an initialization list, where the target to be mutated may be
186  * a const reference. */
187  Target without_feature(Feature f) const;
188 
189  /** Is a fully feature GPU compute runtime enabled? I.e. is
190  * Func::gpu_tile and similar going to work? Currently includes
191  * CUDA, OpenCL, Metal and D3D12Compute. We do not include OpenGL,
192  * because it is not capable of gpgpu, and is not scheduled via
193  * Func::gpu_tile.
194  * TODO: Should OpenGLCompute be included here? */
195  bool has_gpu_feature() const;
196 
197  /** Does this target allow using a certain type. Generally all
198  * types except 64-bit float and int/uint should be supported by
199  * all backends.
200  *
201  * It is likely better to call the version below which takes a DeviceAPI.
202  */
203  bool supports_type(const Type &t) const;
204 
205  /** Does this target allow using a certain type on a certain device.
206  * This is the prefered version of this routine.
207  */
208  bool supports_type(const Type &t, DeviceAPI device) const;
209 
210  /** Returns whether a particular device API can be used with this
211  * Target. */
212  bool supports_device_api(DeviceAPI api) const;
213 
214  /** If this Target (including all Features) requires a specific DeviceAPI,
215  * return it. If it doesn't, return DeviceAPI::None. If the Target has
216  * features with multiple (different) DeviceAPI requirements, the result
217  * will be an arbitrary DeviceAPI. */
218  DeviceAPI get_required_device_api() const;
219 
220  bool operator==(const Target &other) const {
221  return os == other.os &&
222  arch == other.arch &&
223  bits == other.bits &&
224  features == other.features;
225  }
226 
227  bool operator!=(const Target &other) const {
228  return !(*this == other);
229  }
230 
231  /**
232  * Create a "greatest common denominator" runtime target that is compatible with
233  * both this target and \p other. Used by generators to conveniently select a suitable
234  * runtime when linking together multiple functions.
235  *
236  * @param other The other target from which we compute the gcd target.
237  * @param[out] result The gcd target if we return true, otherwise unmodified. Can be the same as *this.
238  * @return Whether it was possible to find a compatible target (true) or not.
239  */
240  bool get_runtime_compatible_target(const Target &other, Target &result);
241 
242  /** Convert the Target into a string form that can be reconstituted
243  * by merge_string(), which will always be of the form
244  *
245  * arch-bits-os-feature1-feature2...featureN.
246  *
247  * Note that is guaranteed that Target(t1.to_string()) == t1,
248  * but not that Target(s).to_string() == s (since there can be
249  * multiple strings that parse to the same Target)...
250  * *unless* t1 contains 'unknown' fields (in which case you'll get a string
251  * that can't be parsed, which is intentional).
252  */
253  std::string to_string() const;
254 
255  /** Given a data type, return an estimate of the "natural" vector size
256  * for that data type when compiling for this Target. */
257  int natural_vector_size(const Halide::Type &t) const;
258 
259  /** Given a data type, return an estimate of the "natural" vector size
260  * for that data type when compiling for this Target. */
261  template<typename data_t>
262  int natural_vector_size() const {
263  return natural_vector_size(type_of<data_t>());
264  }
265 
266  /** Return true iff 64 bits and has_feature(LargeBuffers). */
267  bool has_large_buffers() const {
268  return bits == 64 && has_feature(LargeBuffers);
269  }
270 
271  /** Return the maximum buffer size in bytes supported on this
272  * Target. This is 2^31 - 1 except on 64-bit targets when the LargeBuffers
273  * feature is enabled, which expands the maximum to 2^63 - 1. */
274  int64_t maximum_buffer_size() const {
275  if (has_large_buffers()) {
276  return (((uint64_t)1) << 63) - 1;
277  } else {
278  return (((uint64_t)1) << 31) - 1;
279  }
280  }
281 
282  /** Get the minimum cuda capability found as an integer. Returns
283  * 20 (our minimum supported cuda compute capability) if no cuda
284  * features are set. */
285  int get_cuda_capability_lower_bound() const;
286 
287  /** Was libHalide compiled with support for this target? */
288  bool supported() const;
289 
290  /** Return a bitset of the Featuress set in this Target (set = 1).
291  * Note that while this happens to be the current internal representation,
292  * that might not always be the case. */
293  const std::bitset<FeatureEnd> &get_features_bitset() const {
294  return features;
295  }
296 
297  /** Return the name corresponding to a given Feature, in the form
298  * used to construct Target strings (e.g., Feature::Debug is "debug" and not "Debug"). */
299  static std::string feature_to_name(Target::Feature feature);
300 
301  /** Return the feature corresponding to a given name, in the form
302  * used to construct Target strings (e.g., Feature::Debug is "debug" and not "Debug").
303  * If the string is not a known feature name, return FeatureEnd. */
304  static Target::Feature feature_from_name(const std::string &name);
305 
306 private:
307  /** A bitmask that stores the active features. */
308  std::bitset<FeatureEnd> features;
309 };
310 
311 /** Return the target corresponding to the host machine. */
312 Target get_host_target();
313 
314 /** Return the target that Halide will use. If HL_TARGET is set it
315  * uses that. Otherwise calls \ref get_host_target */
316 Target get_target_from_environment();
317 
318 /** Return the target that Halide will use for jit-compilation. If
319  * HL_JIT_TARGET is set it uses that. Otherwise calls \ref
320  * get_host_target. Throws an error if the architecture, bit width,
321  * and OS of the target do not match the host target, so this is only
322  * useful for controlling the feature set. */
323 Target get_jit_target_from_environment();
324 
325 /** Get the Target feature corresponding to a DeviceAPI. For device
326  * apis that do not correspond to any single target feature, returns
327  * Target::FeatureEnd */
328 Target::Feature target_feature_for_device_api(DeviceAPI api);
329 
330 namespace Internal {
331 
332 void target_test();
333 }
334 
335 } // namespace Halide

DeviceAPI.h
Defines DeviceAPI.
HalideRuntime.h
This file declares the routines used by Halide internally in its runtime.
